Interface View

All Known Implementing Classes:
ViewResult, ViewTable
public interface View
The View interface defines the methods that must be implemented by any class responsible for displaying and interacting with the view of the application. It includes methods for initializing the view, performing calculations, saving and restoring data.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    Collection<CalculationData>
    getItems()
    Returns the list of calculation data objects.
    void
    setItems(ArrayList<CalculationData> items)
    Sets the list of CalculationData items.
    void
    show()
    Displays the results or the content of the view.
    void
    viewCalculate()
    Performs calculations for the data displayed in the view.
    void
    viewInit()
    Initializes the view with necessary data or configurations.
    void
    viewRestore()
    Restores the state of the view from a file or storage medium.
    void
    viewSave()
    Saves the current state of the view to a file or storage medium.

  • Method Details

    • show

      void show()
      Displays the results or the content of the view.

    • viewCalculate

      void viewCalculate()
      Performs calculations for the data displayed in the view.

    • viewSave

      void viewSave() throws IOException
      Saves the current state of the view to a file or storage medium.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs during the saving process

    • viewRestore

      void viewRestore() throws Exception
      Restores the state of the view from a file or storage medium.
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs during the restoration process

    • viewInit

      void viewInit()
      Initializes the view with necessary data or configurations.

    • getItems

      Collection<CalculationData> getItems()
      Returns the list of calculation data objects.
      Returns:
      the list of calculation data objects

    • setItems

      void setItems(ArrayList<CalculationData> items)
      Sets the list of CalculationData items. This method is used to assign a list of CalculationData objects to the implementing class. The implementation will define how this list is stored and processed.
      Parameters:
      items - a list of CalculationData objects to be set
